Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a fish in the water, showing that fish live in aquatic environments.
The student can label the parts of the water environment that the fish needs, such as water and plants.
The student can include and label other living things that are part of the fish's environment, like plants or other water animals.
The student can draw and label resources in the habitat that fish use to survive, such as rocks and algae.
The student can use drawing to show the relationship between the fish and the water, illustrating that fish need water to swim and live.
The student can depict how the water environment and its elements support the needs of fish and other aquatic life.
The student can identify and label how the parts of the fish's environment work together as a system to meet the fish's needs.
